question: 文学
sourceMnemonic: If you <kanji>study</kanji> <kanji>writing</kanji> it's called <vocabulary>literature</vocabulary>. You'll get to study lots of things other people wrote before you!
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. Since <ja>文</ja> has two on'yomi readings, here's a mnemonic to help you remember which one to use:

All the great works of <vocabulary>literature</vocabulary> are about <reading>bun</reading>s (<ja>ぶん</ja>). That's the subtle thread running through all literature: buns.
